answers.answer: I would imagine it would depend on "why" she hasn't awoke yet, whether there is reason to worry, but you will worry regardless.My Dad had major anurysm surgery sveral years ago and it took him 19 days to wake up completely.  Before he woke up, his eyes were open and he was talking, but he wasn't making any sense, and seemed to be living in a fantasy world. The cause was unknown, but we think the hospital overdosed him on morphine, and just were refusing to admit their mistake.  Anyway, he did come out it and went back to life as normal, so don't give up hope.

Never give up hope, and never quit praying.In October I was told I was going to die.  Now my doctors are telling me that my prognosis is good, and I give the credit to the many people who prayed for me.  I am still fighting renal disease and heart failure, but I seem to be getting better, so that's positive.I am now on dialysis 3 days a week, but I'm healthy enough that I have very few constraints on diet and excercise.  Also, instead of having 2 gallons of fluid removed each time, I only have to endure 2 liters of fluid, which is a huge improvement over a year ago.So keep on hoping and praying, I know it helps.
